text: some have labeled as a terrorist the
resistance are brave fighters we are
defending our people from the
government's brutal repression
the way I see it the resistance is
everybody who is against a regime many
people see it as a dictatorship and if
you look at what they're doing that's
what it is really I think the resistance
is those people who come out to protest
who are willing to take the lead to
confront the police or the National
Guard some have labeled us as terrorists
but I think that all of us youth who
make up the resistance are brave
fighters we are defending our people
from the government's brutal repression
our role is also to secure ground
because just as the police and the
National Guard are trying to push us
back we also have to try and seize our
chances to advance
it shouldn't be just up to us to get out
there representing 40-somethings or
30-something I mean they have to come
out as well I think we suffer the worst
of the government's decisions and that's
why we haven't any choice if you want to
gain our independence to move forward
and make a life for ourselves personally
I don't mind giving up my life out there
in the streets if it is for a good cause
I believe I prefer to die than to live
in this way governed by the
Constitutional Assembly and all that the
way I see it I will never be able to
achieve my potential as a person here
because the government isn't letting me
personally I'm scared I'm scared of
dying
I'm scared seeing someone getting killed
to be near them when it happens after
all we are supposed to be fighting for
the sake of living in a better Venezuela
when you're standing behind a shield and
a fire good for value the impact defens
it leaves your ears ringing
there's always a risk that by trying to
see what's going on ahead of you that a
pellet can get through the shield and
hit you in your eye that your eyeball or
it could kill you
I always think that maybe one day my
luck will run out
and I think about those boys who didn't
make it back home every time I get home
from the protest I tell myself that it's
a gift because many of my mates didn't
make it back they may be dead or under
arrest knowing that it's unlikely that
they'll be released this is a country
that have seen many of its youngest
people killed injured or arresting
people IV that commemorates in the lines
lost in this wave of political unrest
and this is very much an open wound and
the consequences are far from known
regardless of who's gonna run this
nation
[Music]
